title: Tata Power Renewable, Tata Communications ink Rs 105 crore pact to set up captive solar project
description: Located in Aachegaon, Maharashtra, the plant is projected to generate approximately 40 million units (MUs) of power while offsetting more than 30,000 tonne of CO2 emissions annually, Tata Power said in a statement.Tata Power Renewable, Tata Communications ink Rs 105 crore pact to set up captive solar project
content: Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd (TPREL) has signed an agreement worth Rs 105 crore with Tata Communications to set up a 18.75 MW captive solar plant in Maharashtra. Located in Aachegaon, Maharashtra, the plant is projected to generate approximately 40 million units (MUs) of power while offsetting more than 30,000 tonne of CO2 emissions annually, Tata Power said in a statement. TPREL has signed a power delivery agreement with Tata Communications for a 18.75 MW group captive solar power plant, it said. TPREL, an arm of Tata Power, has achieved a milestone by surpassing a capacity of over 1.5 gigawatts (GW) in group captive projects. The Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) span a diverse range of industries, including steel, polystyrene, mining, iron casting, manufacturing, hospitality, automotive, among others.
